pageTitle: Critical Values Tables - WakeMed Health & Hospitals, Raleigh, NC
textBeforeTable: Critical Values Critical Laboratory Values are defined as values that represent an immediately life-threatening pathophysiological state for any patient regardless of clinical status and which require prompt intervention. Every effort is made to call all critical laboratory values to a responsible licensed caregiver within 30 minutes. Prothrombin Time   40 sec. International Normalized Ratio (INR)   5.0 Drug Critical Values Drug Equal to or Less Than Equal to or Greater Than Acetaminophen   50 ug/mL Digoxin   2.5 ng/dL Lidocaine   6.5 ug/mL Lithium   1.5 mmol/L Procainamide (+ NAPA)   30 ug/mL Blood Gas Critical Values Blood Gas Test Values Less Than Values Greater Than Arterial Blood Gas: Adult     pH 7.25 units 7.60 units pCO2 25 mmHg
